column4: Hi guys - I am installing Ubuntu using the alternate cd text intallation - I am setting up RAID 1. during the MD setup phase, it asks me how many spare devices I want for the RAID1 array. What are these spare devices?
Are they the same as hot spares?
Where I leave a 3rd "spare" drive connected, wich automatically takes over from a failed drive in the active 2-drive array?
are you sure you want to setup a software raid instead of a hardware raid?
Not a busy machine.
kewl. yeah, iirc, those would be spare drives that could be contributed to the array

I don't need a hot spare. But I have purchased a 3rd hard drive for off-site backups just in case. I was hoping I could "catch up" my off-site backed up data by simply plugging in the 3rd hard drive once a week and mirroring the active drives. Is this possible?
sure, just don't include it in the array and the OS should see it as a separate drive upon the final installation
Ok but then can I at a later stage unplug one of the active drives, plug in the dedicated offsite drive, build a mirror of the data on that, and then take it back out again?
i don't see why not, as long as you follow the MD spec
Ok cool.

I could just export the database and copy over the file system - but it would be nice if I could build a mirror on the offsite drive once a week. It would make the swapping out of a failed drive super quick
i guess it depends on how you want to perform the weekly backup
like bieb said, rsync would be the perfect option
Painlessly! :)
yeah :)

it's a program that fascilitates backup procedures, and has all of the options that windows backup has (incremental, full, etc), but with the added functionality that windows backup lacks (like doing it over the network and over ssh)
i do believe the RAID docs explain that :)
i second bieb's suggestion again ;)
good luck and have fun :)
